trails.fullName: UCI ENDURO WORLD CUP 2023: Pietra Ligure (Pro)
trails.name: UCI ENDURO WORLD CUP 2023: Pietra Ligure (Pro)

trails.fullName: UCI XCM WORLD CUP 2023 FINALE OUTDOOR REGION
trails.name: UCI XCM WORLD CUP 2023 FINALE OUTDOOR REGION
trails.descriptionShort: The UCI Marathon World Cup is the new exciting sporting event of the Finale Outdoor Region, with start and finish in the charming medieval village of  Finalborgo, a 100 km course with over 3500 m of elevation gain and tons of single tracks!

trails.name: Bardineto & Lago di Osiglia (Gravel Tour)
trails.descriptionShort: A route starting and finishing in Bardineto, with a scenic passage by the beautiful Lago di Osiglia. Suitable for gravel bikes, monstercross and MTBs.

trails.fullName: Pietra Ligure: Touch the Sky (Gravel Tour)
trails.name: Pietra Ligure: Touch the Sky (Gravel Tour)
trails.descriptionShort: Dal mare al cielo.... Un tour che riempe gli occhi

trails.fullName: Bardineto & Lago di Osiglia Long Version (Gravel Tour)
trails.name: Bardineto & Lago di Osiglia Long Version (Gravel Tour)
trails.descriptionShort: Bardineto - Lago di Osiglia Long Version - Gravel Tour

trails.name: Discover Bardineto (Gravel Tour)
trails.descriptionShort: Bardineto Gravel Experience 1

trails.fullName: Liguria Bike Escapes - Barbottina Version 2 - Finale Outdoor Region
trails.name: Liguria Bike Escapes - Barbottina Version 2 - Finale Outdoor Region
trails.descriptionShort: The Barbottina Forest can be enjoyed all year round thanks to a beautiful loop trail. In spring, you can witness nature awakening; in summer, the fresh air offers a welcome break from the heat. Autumn is ideal for admiring the splendid foliage, with colours ranging from yellow and orange to deep red, while in winter the forest takes on a mysterious charm when hidden in mist

trails.name: Le Tagliate Round Loop (Gravel Tour)
trails.descriptionShort: Suitable for both gravel and monster cross / MTB bikes, this route explores the inland hills and includes a visit to the iconic Base Nato.

trails.name: Heart Gravel (Gravel Tour)
trails.descriptionShort: Loop con partenza e arrivo nel cuore di FOR

trails.name: I Borghi (Gravel Tour)
trails.descriptionShort: Bardineto - Zuccarello - Castelvecchio di Rocca Barbena

trails.fullName: UCI ENDURO WORLD CUP 2025: Pietra Ligure day 1 (Pro)
trails.name: UCI ENDURO WORLD CUP 2025: Pietra Ligure day 1 (Pro)

trails.fullName: UCI ENDURO WORLD CUP 2025: Pietra Ligure day 2 (Pro) & Enduro Open
trails.name: UCI ENDURO WORLD CUP 2025: Pietra Ligure day 2 (Pro) & Enduro Open
24H
trails.descriptionShort: The track that hosts the “Most epic 24H race in the world”. (24H Finale)

trails.name: Sentiero dei Ciechi
trails.descriptionShort: Easy and accessible single track from Magnone to Le Manie.

trails.name: Acquaviva
trails.descriptionShort: Very steep and direct access to the plateau

trails.name: Briga Sinistra
trails.descriptionShort: Easier alternative to Briga Destra. Different but eaqually interesting.

trails.name: Polveriera
trails.descriptionShort: The connection gravel road from Le Manie to the Magnone area.

trails.name: Radici
trails.descriptionShort: Gravel, steep and roots for this E-Bike climb

trails.name: Andrassa pt.1
trails.descriptionShort: Flowing and fun trail alternating moderately rocky sections with a smoother final part

trails.name: Sentiero Amico
trails.descriptionShort: Easy connection to Noli starting from Le Manie.

trails.name: Voltage
trails.descriptionShort: Specific 24H of Finale E-Bike version.

trails.name: Anello dell'Arma
trails.descriptionShort: A classic XC Finale loop.

trails.name: Cave
trails.descriptionShort: Wonderful trail that rides beside a stunning medieval quarry.

trails.name: Manie Uphill
trails.descriptionShort: Compelling access to Le Manie plateau.

trails.name: Fornaci
trails.descriptionShort: Trail access to Isasco from Le Manie.

trails.name: Brighella
trails.descriptionShort: Briga's little sister.

trails.name: Andrassa pt.2
trails.descriptionShort: For nose press and bike trial enthusiasts, a physical trail that is not considered dangerous but should be approached with caution, especially in wet conditions due to slippery rocks.

trails.name: Anello di Pianarella
trails.descriptionShort: Experience a fun loop that can be ridden in both directions which is perfect for getting familiar with your bike and practicing uphill techniques, whether you are using an ebike or relying on your muscles. Enjoy spectacular views of the Eagle Valley, which boasts an overhang of about 300 meters.

trails.name: Dolmen
trails.descriptionShort: A San Bernardino Classic. Techy and rowdy.

trails.name: Ciappi
trails.descriptionShort: The first MTB tour in Finale. A great classic

trails.name: Cucco
trails.descriptionShort: The easiest connection through San Bernardino

trails.name: Cà del Vacchè
trails.descriptionShort: Easy San Bernardino descent

trails.name: Pianarella
trails.descriptionShort: Steep and rowdy, a classic west San Bernardino track

trails.name: Megalithic
trails.descriptionShort: The rock and tight corner fest of San Bernardino.

trails.name: Sporting
trails.descriptionShort: Fabulous connecting trail that crosses terraces of olive groves

trails.name: Diamante
trails.descriptionShort: Easier alternative to Dolmen.

trails.name: Borderline
trails.descriptionShort: Great, epic EWS Stage.

trails.name: Borgata Costa
trails.descriptionShort: Off-road climb to San Bernardino

trails.name: A.N.A.
trails.descriptionShort: A.N.A. follows an old alpine path to reach San Bernardino from Finalborgo

trails.name: X-Ray
trails.descriptionShort: Short access to Dolmen from San Bernardino

trails.name: Cornei Climb
trails.descriptionShort: Steep trail to Orco from Val Cornei

trails.name: Legnino
trails.descriptionShort: Intense uphill challenge on an E-Bike with a fabulous view

trails.name: Black and White
trails.descriptionShort: A treat of a trail. In memory of a loved man.

trails.name: Stalitto Trail
trails.descriptionShort: Variant of the classic dirt road leading to the most famous trails of S. Bernardino and Ciappi.

trails.name: Cucco Uphill
trails.descriptionShort: Fun and moderate e-bike trail to the summit of Monte Cucco, boasting stunning views of the valley and S. Bernardino plateau.

trails.name: Vallunga Uphill
trails.descriptionShort: Trail is a technical uphill climb in typical S. Bernardino style with a picturesque passage below the climbing crags.

trails.name: Collegamento Gorillaz
trails.descriptionShort: Collegamento is an enjoyable ride in both directions, suitable for both muscle and electric bikes. The terrain is typical of S. Bernardino.

trails.name: Gorillaz
trails.descriptionShort: This trail is enjoyable and has a smooth flow. It contains some rocky sections that are fixed in place, as well as some tight turns.

trails.name: H
trails.descriptionShort: Sentiero delle Neviere: a Finale's great classic

trails.name: Base Nato
trails.descriptionShort: First trail ever built in Nato Base

trails.name: H Veloce
trails.descriptionShort: Perfect follow up to the Sentiero delle Neviere (H trail)

trails.name: Madre Natura
trails.descriptionShort: Classic Nato Base flow trail

trails.name: Crestino Pt. 1
trails.descriptionShort: Perhaps the easiest trail in the Finalese area

trails.name: Crestino Pt.2
trails.descriptionShort: More technical continuation of Crestino Pt.1
Similar to the other Nato Base trails, equally fun and fast

trails.name: Cravarezza
trails.descriptionShort: Fast trail with great rhythm and pace

trails.name: Colla San Giacomo AV
trails.descriptionShort: The best trail-access road of the Nato Base area

trails.name: Variante Crestino
trails.descriptionShort: Short alternative to Strada della Colla. Connection from Crestino to Rocche Bianche

trails.name: Ingegnere
trails.descriptionShort: The Enduro stage example

trails.name: Partigiano
trails.descriptionShort: Easy access to Nato Base

trails.name: Val Nava
trails.descriptionShort: Very fast trail in an area also famous for climbing

trails.name: Rocche Gianche
trails.descriptionShort: One of the best panoramas of the Finalese, one of the most technical trails of the Finalese.

trails.name: Supergroppo
trails.descriptionShort: Long, flowing, very complete trail: fun lines, small climbs, and varied terrains.

trails.name: Orco Colla San Giacomo
trails.descriptionShort: Both-way gravel road that from Orco gets to Colla di San Giacomo.

trails.name: Colla San Giacomo - Rocche Gianche
trails.descriptionShort: Connection from Colla di San Giacomo to the trails in Rocche Bianche.

trails.name: Variante Rocche Gianche
trails.descriptionShort: Nice single track that lets you skip the hardest tecky part of Rocche Gianche.

trails.name: Monte Alto
trails.descriptionShort: Sentiero che garantisce l'accesso ad alcuni sentieri di Mallare ed al Supergroppo

trails.name: Tagliate
trails.descriptionShort: Easy option in a fabulous environment.

trails.name: Rollercoaster
trails.descriptionShort: A trail you must do at least once. Fast and fun. Unmatchable!

trails.name: Rollercoaster-San Pantaleo
trails.descriptionShort: The second part of the Rollercoaster is more technical, but still enjoyable.

trails.name: Toboga di Canova Upper
trails.descriptionShort: The trail is enjoyable and diverse, with a good balance of pace and terrain changes while not being too extreme.

trails.name: Toboga di Canova Lower
trails.descriptionShort: The trail is long and diverse, with many banked curves and stepped sections making it a lot of fun to ride!

trails.name: Roll Up
trails.descriptionShort: 5 km of pure e-mtb for a trail set to become a great classic.

trails.name: Collarina
trails.descriptionShort: From the SP490 to the top of Rollercoaster

trails.name: Bric Merizzo
trails.descriptionShort: A quick and enjoyable warm-up stretch, like an appetizer, before facing Isallo Exstasi or Fast & Furious with the right attitude.

trails.name: Tagliego (Rialto - Din)
trails.descriptionShort: Gravel road connection to reach the Din Trail area.

trails.name: Din
trails.descriptionShort: Fun and quick trail from the top of Settepani mountain.

trails.name: Fast and Furious
trails.descriptionShort: Legendary trail by Ale Massa

trails.name: Isallo Extasi
trails.descriptionShort: 5km of the finest riding!

trails.name: Revenant
trails.descriptionShort: Last fast part of Isallo Extasi

trails.name: Mugugno
trails.descriptionShort: E-Bike specific climb to access Revenant and Issalo

trails.name: Issalo
trails.descriptionShort: 4kms of pure uphill E-Bike fun. This trail is the access to the high area above Pietra, home of Isallo Extasi, Barbottina and even Rollercoaster.

trails.name: Orera Trail
trails.descriptionShort: A short section, perfect for getting a feel of what the Caprazoppa area is all about: fixed rocks and earth on medium-technical passages that are super fun to tackle.

trails.name: Bondi
trails.descriptionShort: A fantastic typical Finale EWS stage: technical, rocky, fast with some climbing inside.

trails.name: Strada della Cappelletta
trails.descriptionShort: Two-way access route to the Caprazoppa plateau

trails.name: Melanzana
trails.descriptionShort: This uphill trail is super fun and challenging!

trails.name: X-Men
trails.descriptionShort: Passages between dry stone walls on red earth, stones and hairpin bends

trails.name: Sentiero delle Spine
trails.descriptionShort: Breve tratto facile che segue una cresta e permette di evitare parte dell'asfalto della SP 490 salendo o scendendo dal Colle del Melogno.

trails.name: Parsifal
trails.descriptionShort: Trail with a panoramic start, great both uphill and downhill

trails.name: Terra di Mezzo
trails.descriptionShort: A labirynth of tight corners, ups and downs, and rocky sections.

trails.name: Gorra Uphill
trails.descriptionShort: Returning to Finale from Borgio Verezzi, this is the best way

trails.name: Geologico
trails.descriptionShort: Panoramic and tecky. Rocky terrain

trails.name: Strinate
trails.descriptionShort: Steep and tecky descent from Gorra to Borgio Verezzi

trails.name: Madonna della Guardia
trails.descriptionShort: Fast and very tecky Finale Classic

trails.name: Cavatappi Upper
trails.descriptionShort: One of the hardest trails in the area.

trails.name: Kill Bill 1
trails.descriptionShort: Number 1 masterpiece by Ale Massa

trails.name: Kill Bill 2
trails.descriptionShort: Number 2 masterpiece by Ale Massa

trails.name: Cacciatore
trails.descriptionShort: Shown to Fabrizio Valenti (the original trailbuilder) by a hunter, that gives the name.

trails.name: Cavatappi Lower
trails.descriptionShort: Experienced bikers will be challenged by the sharp bends in a gully and steep terrain in the forest, making this a truly iconic section of the Region.

trails.name: Collarina Originale
trails.descriptionShort: Steep gravel road up to Madonna della Guardia

trails.name: Mao Crest
trails.descriptionShort: Trail that made the history of the Finalese.

trails.name: Cava-Green Carpet
trails.descriptionShort: Scenic and accessible path of Spotorno

trails.name: Gump
trails.descriptionShort: Short single-track climb from Foresto back to Ranzi trail area.

trails.name: One Shot
trails.descriptionShort: Up-and-down single track that rides alongside the bottom of the Giustenice Valley.

trails.name: Tino
trails.descriptionShort: Best way to e-ride to Ranzi!

trails.name: Scoglio di Venso
trails.descriptionShort: Takes its name from a specific rock formation you'll encounter in the middle of this trail.

trails.name: Dolcenera
trails.descriptionShort: Tecky trail with some fantastic views of the coast and sea in Pietra Ligure.

trails.name: Trincea
trails.descriptionShort: Short, E-MTB link trail to Monte Ciazze Secche

trails.name: Blu Pervinca
trails.descriptionShort: Wonderful single track that connects the high trails of Pietra Ligure to the entire Ranzi area.

trails.name: Oltrefinale
trails.descriptionShort: Flow and curves, many curves!

trails.name: Titalana
trails.descriptionShort: "The most fun I had on a trail" Cit. Chris Ball

trails.name: RocknRolla
trails.descriptionShort: Rock'n'Roll trail in Pietra

trails.name: Dog Eat Dog
trails.descriptionShort: Fast narrow and tecky, all you want to top your experience in Pietra.

trails.name: Karma Trail
trails.descriptionShort: This trail is the epic experience par excellence.

trails.name: Pollaio Felice
trails.descriptionShort: Fun e-bike trail with easy and technical sections on dry and compact terrain, and some rocky bits too.

trails.name: Gabry
trails.descriptionShort: Short and great fun, flowy and fast!

trails.name: Hay Trail (Sentiero del Fieno)
trails.descriptionShort: It passes on an old medieval path and it is a very rocky trail. Great uphill challenge!

trails.name: Carmo per Sempre
trails.descriptionShort: Feel like you're in an alpine landscape just a few steps from the sea

trails.name: Ranzi Uphill
trails.descriptionShort: Extremely nice climb through Ranzi.

trails.name: Foresto
trails.descriptionShort: Downhill trail to the Foresto area that keeps going towards the lower part of Giustenice

trails.name: Aleluya
trails.descriptionShort: Similar trail to Rock'n'Rolla

trails.name: Strada delle Gatelle
trails.descriptionShort: Great white road to which many trails of the Pietra area get to

trails.name: Scala Santa
trails.descriptionShort: Technical trail with fixed rock passages and treacherous gullies to navigate on sight for experienced riders.

trails.name: XC Giustenice
trails.descriptionShort: A beautiful and scenic singletrack to descend from Giustenice after riding the Pietra Ligure outdoor trails.

trails.name: Hiroshima Mon Amour
trails.descriptionShort: Fast and steep trail in the Pietra Ligure area

trails.name: True to the Line
trails.descriptionShort: When the Uranium Road becomes a trail

trails.name: Hell Boy part 1
trails.descriptionShort: The perfect follow-up to Hiroshima Mon Amour

trails.name: Hell Boy part 2
trails.descriptionShort: Tratti molto veloci in una foresta di castagni.

trails.name: Madonnina
trails.descriptionShort:
Short and technical climb to reach the Ranzi area.
It crosses a couple of paved roads and includes some short technical and interesting sections.

trails.name: Armuin
trails.descriptionShort: Great panoramic trail in the Ranzi area

trails.name: CNC
trails.descriptionShort: A beutiful technical single-track that connects Ranzi town to Ranzi Trail center.Not one inch of tramac to get there.

trails.name: Asinolla Uphill
trails.descriptionShort:
This short climb on asphalt and trail is the perfect access to Asinolla Park. It also allows a following descent towards the village of Ranzi.
Easy and fast, it is the best alternative to asphalt.

trails.name: Route Bella
trails.descriptionShort: Perfect route for E-Bike. Being part of a very extensive network of uphill trails, it allows you to reach the Giogo di Giustenice area via single-track.

trails.name: Finale Oltre
trails.descriptionShort:
Brilliant piece of uphill, E-Bike single track, filled with tight corners and nice challenges.
Once a dowhill trail, it has been re-evaluated as an uphill one for greater success.

trails.name: Salite di Livello Pt.1
trails.descriptionShort: Short uphill connection from Cascina Porro to  Strada dell'Uranio.

trails.name: Salite di Livello Pt.2
trails.descriptionShort: Steep and short uphill single track from Strada dell'Uranio to Bric Pratello.

trails.name: Stai Carmo
trails.descriptionShort: A brilliant connection from Bric Pratello down to the beginning of Titalana. A short curvy, tecky trail with some very speedy parts.

trails.name: Sugheri
trails.descriptionShort:
Monte Grosso area, currently the mecca for E-Bike in the Finale Outdoor Region.
Sugheri is one of many uphill trails specifically for e-bikes.

trails.name: Vaixella
trails.descriptionShort: Access to Monte Grosso from the back of the mountain. Extremely accessible by car, this trail is a perfect E-Bike climb up to the Monte Grosso trail area.

trails.name: Acquedotto
trails.descriptionShort: Thanks to its technical level and fabulous scenery on the Ligurian coast, Acquedotto is a gem of the Pietrese coast

trails.name: Muro Nero
trails.descriptionShort: The perfect access to the top of Monte Grosso

trails.name: Rose di Pietra
trails.descriptionShort: The real uphill E-Bike challenge

trails.name: Wheels of Pietra
trails.descriptionShort: From panoramic sections to very fun lines among cork trees

trails.name: Cuore di Cervo
trails.descriptionShort: Compelling and scenic descent from Monte Grosso

trails.name: Monte Grosso Uphill
trails.descriptionShort: Optimal follow-up to Vaixella

trails.name: Spillover
trails.descriptionShort: Trail with beautiful views of Pietra Ligure and banked bends is very playful and fun.

trails.name: Pian Marino-Cia
trails.descriptionShort: Link section between the south and north area of Feglino (Ivolandia)

trails.name: Pino Morto
trails.descriptionShort: One of the fastest, rockyest train in the area

trails.name: Oribago
trails.descriptionShort: Tight and flowy

trails.name: Oribago 2
trails.descriptionShort: Great alternative to Oribago

trails.name: Strada della Cava
trails.descriptionShort: Wide, steep rocky trail that links Orco Valley to the Rocca Carpanea area

trails.name: Ötzi
trails.descriptionShort: Perfect "Ivo style" trail

trails.name: Neanderthal
trails.descriptionShort: A classic Feglino trail, udes multiple times as Enduro stage

trails.name: Cromagnon
trails.descriptionShort: Trail with the iconic section underneath 2 massive rocks

trails.name: Pian Marino Top
trails.descriptionShort: Access to many trails of the Feglino area

trails.name: Campogrande-San Rocco
trails.descriptionShort: Off-road access from Calice Ligure to San Rocco

trails.name: Margot
trails.descriptionShort: Curvy and compelling

trails.name: Final-Borgo
trails.descriptionShort: At the beginning, the trail is medium level and becomes very technical towards the end. It offers a stunning view of Finalborgo.

trails.name: Cà Bianca
trails.descriptionShort: Iconic route, very fast with fantastic hairpin bends towards the end

trails.name: Little Champery
trails.descriptionShort: Similar trail to Cà Bianca, somewhere faster and more techy

trails.name: Trail del Boccion
trails.descriptionShort: Longest trail towards Mallare

trails.name: Cadotto
trails.descriptionShort: Connecting dirt road from Mallare to Colla San Giacomo

trails.name: Little Dog
trails.descriptionShort: The first Mallare Trailbuilders' creation

trails.name: Neverland
trails.descriptionShort: Immersed in a beautiful forest

trails.name: Benevento Beeches
trails.descriptionShort: The path runs alongside the three Benevento Ancient Beeches

trails.name: Carbonera
trails.descriptionShort: Short trail with fast and techy lines.

trails.name: Black Mamba
trails.descriptionShort: One of the most technical and fun trails of the Mallare area.

trails.name: Dondella
trails.descriptionShort: One of the most beautiful trails in Bardineto!

trails.name: Cormore
trails.descriptionShort: One of the trails accessing the Bardineto area from the Melogno zone.

trails.name: Mulino
trails.descriptionShort: One of the most amusing trails in Bardineto.

trails.name: Pianfieno
trails.descriptionShort: From Catalano to Bardineto, the best way to enter the village from Melogno.

trails.name: Pagliarina
trails.descriptionShort: Explore the sea-facing side with this very varied ridge-line trail.

trails.name: Avioai
trails.descriptionShort: Beautiful trail in the wild valley of Rio Avioai.

trails.name: Green River
trails.descriptionShort: The latest arrival! An iconic farmhouse, a majestic beech forest, a wild stream with waterfalls and ponds... A common thread: the green! Experience a different emotion!!

trails.name: Appendaun
trails.descriptionShort:
New entrance to the Bardineto area for those arriving from Melogno or the Giogo di Giustenice.
For everyone!!

trails.name: Tobogazzo
trails.descriptionShort: Un sentiero incredibille! Nei sui 3.6 km racchiude tutte le caratteristiche che si possono trovare in Liguria: flow, tecnico, velocità e toboga.

trails.name: Trail della Foglia
trails.descriptionShort: Il gemello diverso del vicino Tobogazzo! Un susseguirsi di curve e canaloni da togliere il fiato

trails.name: Il Conte
trails.descriptionShort:
Fiore all'occhiello della vallata,
Un fantastico trail che si snoda sinuoso tra noccioli, castagni e borghi suggestivi.

trails.name: La Contessa
trails.descriptionShort: Il tipico sentiero ligure: tecnico, roccioso, veloce e con una salita nel tratto centrale.

trails.name: Euforia
trails.descriptionShort: Storia e flow, Euforia collega la frazione di Vecersio a Zuccarello

trails.name: Valle Auzza
trails.descriptionShort: Valle Auzza, Una discesa mozzafiato adatta ai bikers più esperti.

trails.name: Rio
trails.descriptionShort: Poco sopra Gazzo nasce questo sentiero che si snoda tra castagni secolari e corre armonioso lungo il Rio Collarea.

trails.name: Ca du Campo
trails.descriptionShort:
Trail che scende in picchiata direttamente nell’abitato di Castelvecchio di Rocca Barbena, veloce e divertente, con la presenza di alcuni salti e compressioni che lo rendono molto adrenalinico. 
Durante quasi tutta la discesa si gode di una splendida vista sul borgo medioevale e il suo castello, la location ideale per scattare qualche foto ricordo

trails.name: Super Canaletta
trails.descriptionShort:
Trail veloce, con pendenze non eccessive. Si parte da un prato scosceso sul colle Scravaion dal quale si può godere di una splendida vista sulla valle.
Diviso in due tronconi. Un fondo naturale che risulta più roccioso e sconnesso nella parte finale.
Alcuni tratti di ciottolato ricordano l'antico utilizzo come via di comunicazione tra Castelvecchio e Bardineto

trails.name: New Super Canaletta
trails.descriptionShort:
Trail molto lavorato con sponde e compressioni, all’ombra dei castagni attraversa antiche zone di produzione di carbone.
Pendenze non troppo elevate e molto flow!
Termina a pochi metri dalla seconda parte di “super Canaletta” se si svolta a sinistra; svoltando a destra ci si ritroverà invece in direzione Praetto

trails.name: Parpage
trails.descriptionShort:
Partenza da Pian dei Prati, luogo di cruente battaglie napoleoniche dal quale si gode di una fantastica vista mare. 
La prima parte attraversa un bosco di pini, per poi lasciare spazio ai classici castagni, carpini e frassini.
Trail naturale, nella parte finale presenta una parte ciottolata molto veloce.

trails.name: Bardineto BeActive
trails.descriptionShort: Triple loop route to explore all areas of Bardineto.

trails.name: Carmo double loop
trails.descriptionShort: Challenging but extremely rewarding double loop, allowing you to explore the Carmo from two sides, reaching the summit and enjoying spectacular views along the entire route.
